intro: Cnidoscolus urens var. stimulosus, commonly known as the Mexican bristleleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
